intro: Brassica oleracea convar. bullata, commonly known as the curly cabbage, is a cultivar characterized by its tightly curled, compact leaves. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is closely related to other members of the Brassica genus. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dense, fleshy leaves that form a rounded head. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as for culinary use in various cuisines. The leaves are rich in nutrients and have a mild, slightly sweet flavor when cooked.
